thread.title: Bills running back McCoy's status uncertain against Giants

title: Bills running back McCoy's status uncertain against Giants
text:

Join the Conversation To find out more about Facebook commenting please read the Conversation Guidelines and FAQs Bills running back McCoy's status uncertain against Giants The Buffalo Bills will most likely be without Sammy Watkins and LeSean McCoy in the upcoming game against the New York Giants WGRZ 6:40 p.m. EDT September 30, 2015 Sep 27, 2015; Miami Gardens, FL, USA; Buffalo Bills running back LeSean McCoy (25) is tackled by Miami Dolphins defensive tackle Earl Mitchell (90) during the first half at Sun Life Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Steve Mitchell-USA TODAY Sports (Photo: Steve Mitchell, Steve Mitchell-USA TODAY Sports) CONNECT 11 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
ORCHARD PARK, N.Y. (AP) - Buffalo Bills coach Rex Ryan says there's a "real possibility" running back LeSean McCoy will not play against the New York Giants on Sunday because of a nagging injury to his left hamstring. 
Ryan said Wednesday before practice that "it doesn't look good." But he won't entirely rule out McCoy from playing. 
The injury has nagged and slowed McCoy since he was hurt during a joint practice with the Cleveland Browns on Aug. 18. McCoy sat out Buffalo's final preseason games before playing a limited role in a season-opening win over Indianapolis on Sept. 13. 
VIDEO: Adam Benigni updates Bills Watkins, McCoy status Adam Benigni updates Bills' Watkins, McCoy status WGRZ 
Following a 41-14 win at Miami on Sunday, both Ryan and McCoy acknowledged that rest might be the best option to give the injury time to heal. 
The Bills (2-1) host the New York Giants (1-2) on Sunday.
